mdRecord.dcterms:title: Korean Minister and Secretaries of Legation at Mount Vernon, 1889
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Possibly - Dillon, Luke C., 1836-1904
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Black and white photograph of the Korean Minister and party with Secretaries of Legation on the east lawn in front of the Mansion, May 6, 1889. From left to right: Ye Ha Yong (Chargé d’affaires of Korean Legation in Washington D.C. from 1888.11~1889.06), Mrs. Ye Cha Yun, Ye Cha Yun (Second Secretary of Legation), Ye Wan Yong (First Secretary of Legation; later became Chargé d’affaires of Korean Legation in Washington D. C. from 1889.06~1890.09), and Mrs. Ye Wan Yong. The south porch and balustrade are visible as well as visitors in the background. The photograph is adhered to a cardboard mount with a handwritten description below. On the reverse is an unrelated photograph of the Prince Philippe of Orléans, Count of Paris - see separate record (DA_001798).
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Mount Vernon (Va. : Estate)
